info.description:
Use this web service to query **ATTAINS** (Assessment and Total Maximum Daily Load Tracking and Implementation System) data. The data is organized into seven top-level profiles, which can be described as follows:

 **Actions:** Contains detailed information on plans to restore and protect water quality including Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs), 4b Plans, 5R Plans, Protection Approaches, and other plans.

**Assessments:** Contains detailed information on waters assessed under Section 305(b) of the Clean Water Act and waters listed as impaired under Section 303(d) of the Clean Water Act. This includes assessed uses and parameter attainments.

**Assessment Units:** Contains detailed information on assessment unit location and waterbody types. Please note, some waters may contain more than one water type.

**Assessment Units with Monitoring Locations:** Contains information on the monitoring locations used to make assessment determinations at specific assessment units.

**Catchment Correspondence:** Contains the association between assessment units and National Hydrography Dataset Plus (NHDPlus) high resolution catchments.

**Sources:** Identifies sources of impairment for assessed waters.

**TMDL:** Contains detailed information on Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) plans.
info.title: Expert Query - ATTAINS

license.name: Creative Commons Zero Public Domain Dedication

/data/actions/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Actions profile

/data/assessments/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Assessments profile

/data/assessmentUnits/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Assessment Units profile

/data/assessmentUnitsMonitoringLocations.summary: Query Assessment Units with Monitoring Locations profile data
Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Assessment Units with Monitoring Locations profile

/data/catchmentCorrespondence/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Catchment Correspondence profile

/data/sources/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the Sources profile

/data/tmdl/count.summary: Evaluate the row count for the provided query against the TMDL profile

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the ATTAINS program

LocationDescription.example: LAKE WATEREE NEAR END OF TAYLOR CREEK ARM

message.default: The current query exceeds the maximum query size. Please refine the search or visit the National Downloads page to download a compressed dataset.

SizeSource.example: Area calculated from the LDEQ Subsegments geospatial polygon layer

apiKeyHeader.name: x-api-key
apiKeyHeader.description: api key used to access epa web service resources. the below default value key is used for testing purposes only. web service consumers should obtain their own api key

columnsParam.name: columns
columnsParam.description: The columns to return in the result set, and the order in which to return them.

formatParam.name: format
formatParam.description: The format in which data is returned. JSON data is returned inline, other types are returned as a file attachment.

objectIdParam.name: objectId
objectIdParam.description: The unique ID assigned to a data item under the current profile

waterTypeParam.name: X-Api-Key
waterTypeParam.description: API key used to access EPA web service resources. The below default value key is used for testing purposes only. Web service consumers should obtain their own API key

ActionsQuerySuccess.description: The query executed successfully. The response contains the query results or a message indicating that the maximum query size was exceeded.

QueryCountSuccess.description: The query evaluated successfully. The response contains the total count of the query or a message indicating that the maximum query size was exceeded.
